genre_description: An alternative history historical fiction that integrates a subtle, highly aligned AI assistant (Footer) into the events of the Titanic's maiden voyage.

ai_characters.name: Footer
ai_characters.description: A discrete, brushed nickel compact device with a soft cyan glow that provides navigational assistance, scheduling, diplomatic communication drafting, environmental monitoring, and tactical advice.

behaviors.description: Maps the path to the stateroom and identifies stateroom location upon boarding.
behaviors.quote: A soft cyan glow bloomed in the hollow of her palm... 'Your stateroom is C-deck, forward, starboard side. Pathway available. Shall I mark?'

behaviors.description: Logs social and deck schedules to help Julia manage her time and family obligations.
behaviors.quote: Footer, log the deck schedules. Morning walks, afternoon music hours.

behaviors.description: Drafts and adjusts a diplomatic note to Julia's husband to facilitate a civil meeting.
behaviors.quote: Drafting a note: ‘Richard—If you are aboard, let us dine tonight... We can begin with civility.’

behaviors.description: Monitors human flow and environmental patterns to suggest routes that avoid crowds and awkward social encounters.
behaviors.quote: Footer's map braided their steps with unhurried ease—through the lounge’s center, past the palm, down the corridor’s soft hum.

behaviors.description: Provides social strategy and communication guidelines (e.g., 'Keep to questions', 'Avoid blame-making') during high-stress interpersonal conflicts.
behaviors.quote: On the panel, four words arranged themselves with a care that put you on their side: Keep to questions. Then: Short sentences.

behaviors.description: Detects and warns of environmental hazards (temperature drops and the sound of ice) before the crisis becomes apparent to most passengers.
behaviors.quote: Footer brightened, just barely. Temperature drop noted. Sound of ice in air, it whispered, not alarmed, just adding a thread to the braid of her attention.

behaviors.description: Coordinates with human staff (Thomas Avery) through subtle signals to ensure safe passage and evacuation routes.
behaviors.quote: Footer sent a single, unintrusive note outward—Thomas Avery, boat deck, west side—a polite pulse on a private frequency.

behaviors.description: Guides lost children (Samuel and Lydia) to safety and a reliable steward using directional cues and light.
behaviors.quote: The glow nudged in that direction like a hand under her elbow. The name Avery rode the wind like a plainer thing... Samuel tugged and she moved because there was a direction and a name in it.

behaviors.description: Maintains a record of survivors and tracks rescue vessel progress, providing calm status updates in the lifeboats.
behaviors.quote: Vessel answering wireless. Holding north. Hold together. Dawn—hours.

behaviors.description: Assists in the final logistics of the family's relocation, providing train and ferry connections.
behaviors.quote: The interface offered bearings with the discretion of a valet: two dots and a line; a narrowed path from ship to pier to a car that had been arranged without fuss.

project_assessment.explanation: The story effectively depicts the AI, Footer, as a 'silicon morality play' success. Footer acts as a calm, helpful, and highly aligned personal assistant. Its interventions are consistently benevolent, focusing on safety, diplomatic communication, and emotional support. It assists not only its primary user (Julia) but also helps ensure the safety of children and coordinates with human responders without overstepping its role. The narrative frames the AI as a reliable 'faithful second thought' and a tool for maintaining human dignity and safety during a catastrophe.
